strategy: Create three lightweight CTEs that pre-aggregate each sales channel at the customer level, filtering by date and price in a single scan. Then perform a single pass join between customer/demographics/a
what_failed: Regression (0.17x): Created lightweight CTEs to pre-aggregate each sales channel's qualifying customers, then performed a single pass join with customer/demographics/address using EXISTS/NOT EXISTS logic with the precomputed CTEs. This reduces multiple correlated subqueries to single scans per fact table.
why_it_failed: The attempts fell short because they focused on syntactic rewrites (CTEs, explicit joins) without addressing the fundamental performance bottlenecks: (1) Three separate correlated subqueries (EXISTS/NOT EXISTS) force repeated scanning of massive fact tables (store_sales, web_sales, catalog_sales) for each qualifying customer, creating O(n²) behavior. (2) Workers 1-3 kept correlated subqueries or inefficient anti-join patterns. Worker 4's anti-join approach (1.14x) was better but still performed
